page.title: 07Horse Riding
page.content: On the 6th June 1985, our school went to Northfield Farm to find out about ponies. The ponies need shoeing every 3 weeks because, with new riders, their shoes get worn out quickly. They have 35 ponies and they all have names. They buy their ponies from Market. They have cross breeds which are more suitable for trecking. They start grooming and tacking at half past 8. A group of deaf people came to_day so it took longer than normal because they had to explain in sign language. The ponies do not go with people until the ponies are 7 years old because then they aren't so frisky. People come from all over the place to ride at Northfield Farm. The ponies aren't the only income. They also have holiday flats and do farming but ponies get the most income.
